page.title: 08THORNHILL THE MOSS
page.content: The Moss is mostly marshland and scrub and long ago stretched 50 square miles but today less than 20 square miles remain wild.It is split into several sections and the section in the south west corner of our block is called the Carse of Boquhapple.Much of it has been planted and drained.During the 18th and 19th centuries a landowner Lord Kames,who acquired Blairdrummond estate,set out to improve parts of the bog and by 1844,170 acres had been cleared between the River Forth and the Goodie on our map.Today peat is being extracted in this area.In olden days the moss had to be crossed with great care and Rob Roy was reputed to have escaped when being taken captive to Stirling Castle by knowing these routes.
